column4: Please, is there any way to format a fat32 partition as ext3 while running the live cd?
what's that? and how to reach the fat32 partition here firstly?
you just get a shell, and do mke2fs -j /dev/hdXX
the XX depends on the drive and partition
suppose it is the second partition of the first drive, then it is /dev/hda2
how do I list all the partitions?
for a drive, you do    fdisk -l /dev/hda           for the first,    fdisk -l /dev/hdb    for the second, etc.
you need to either be root or use sudo
how to display the sizes of the partitions?
it will show the number of blocks.
or what carthik said works also, of course
